title: Liverpool starlet Harvey Elliott banned for video mocking Harry Kane
text:
Harvey Elliott has been banned by the Football Association for 14 days (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool starlet Harvey Elliott has been banned from playing football at all levels for 14 days.

The 16-year-old featured in a video that appeared on social media in which he appeared to mock Tottenham striker and England national team Harry Kane.

Language used in the footage constituted an ‘aggravated breach’ of Football Association rules and Elliott must complete a face-to-face education course and pay a £350 fine.

Elliott posted the video on Snapchat prior to the Champions League final between Liverpool and Spurs in June after which the former Fulham midfielder posted a heartfelt apology.

He said: ‘The video was taken whilst messing around with friends in a private environment and was not directed at any individual but I realise that my actions were both immature and senseless.

‘I would like to stress that the contents of the video do not represent who I am as a person or how I’ve been brought up, and I am truly sorry.’

Reacting to the suspension, a Liverpool spokesperson said: ‘Harvey’s apology was sincere, immediate and unequivocal. He has acknowledged privately and publicly his actions were wrong.

‘Given his age when this indiscretion was committed – in a private setting and prior to signing for us – we will continue to work with Harvey on an educational basis as relates to his conduct.

‘He has already demonstrated to us a willingness to learn and live up to the values and conduct expected of a Liverpool player.’

Elliott joined Liverpool from Fulham in the summer with a transfer fee set to be decided by a tribunal.

Already the youngest player in Premier League history, Elliott made his senior Liverpool debut during last month’s Carabao Cup victory over MK Dons and will be eligible in time for the fourth round clash against Arsenal on October 30.
